definition: variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]

sentences.english: It is accompanied with possible shock, paralysis, and tissue death.
sentences.chinese: 且同時伴隨着顫慄，麻痹，組織死亡等。

sentences.english: But I do,' said her cousin, shuddering.
sentences.chinese: “可是我在乎，”她的表弟說，顫慄着。

sentences.english: Starlight in the Mou light orders a point, body the very tiny Zhan Li write.
sentences.chinese: 眸光裏星光點點，身子微微的顫慄着。

sentences.english: The man shuddered, torchlight rippling like lightning through his hair.
sentences.chinese: 神祕人顫慄着，火把的光芒像閃電一樣流過他的頭髮。

sentences.english: When day appeared, the serpents retired , and I came out of the cave trembling.
sentences.chinese: 直到日出，巨蛇躲起來之後，我就顫慄地走出洞穴。

sentences.english: I have seen the moment of my greatness flicker.
sentences.chinese: 我曾眼見自身的偉大時刻如葉顫慄。

sentences.english: Look in my heart, kind friends, and tremble.
sentences.chinese: 進來看我的內心吧，親一愛一的朋友，你應顫慄。

sentences.english: I put out the light and returned to bed, palsied with fear.
sentences.chinese: 我熄滅了燈，返回到牀上，心裏顫慄不安。

sentences.english: At that moment, sales person was facing to a shivery winter.
sentences.chinese: 那段時間，銷售員面臨是一個令人顫慄的冬天。

sentences.english: I shall feel myself shudder, suddenly and unawares.
sentences.chinese: 我會突然而不自主地感到自己在顫慄。

sentences.english: A shiver of fright ran through them as he dove from the cliff.
sentences.chinese: 他從懸崖躍下時，恐怖的顫慄掠過了全身。

sentences.english: I shudder to think what might have happened.
sentences.chinese: 我顫慄地想着，下一步會發生什麼？

sentences.english: The “Thriller” video became part of world culture.
sentences.chinese: 《顫慄》的片子已然成爲世界文化的一部分。

sentences.english: Ayn Rand said that "Atlas Shrugged" fully defined her philosophy of Objectivism.
sentences.chinese: 安蘭德說，“地球顫慄”完全確定她的客觀主義哲學。

sentences.english: Grasp it, sense it, tremulous and tender.
sentences.chinese: 抓住它，感受它，顫慄而輕柔。

sentences.english: And I felt just this tremble when I saw this scene.
sentences.chinese: 我看到這景象時，感受到的就是這種程度的顫慄。

definition: to miss/to yearn day and night
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
in the depth of one's soul
lit. liver and guts cut to pieces (idiom)/fig. grief-stricken
